title: Share of male students of lower secondary school age achieving minimum proficiency, by subject
subtitle: The share of children who achieve minimum proficiency by the end of [lower secondary](#dod:lower-secondary-education) education. For [math](#dod:math-proficiency), students can demonstrate skills in computation, application problems, matching tables and graphs, and making use of algebraic representations. For [reading](#dod:reading-proficiency), children can connect main ideas across different text types, understand the author's intentions, and draw conclusions from the text.
